attributes.action: Change divorce law! Make "no fault" divorce possible.
attributes.background: No one wants to encourage a break up. But if couples talk the D-word, it is because the marriage is over. We need a simpler, administrative process that keeps kids safe and won't break the bank. It needs to help people, so they can put their kids first!
attributes.additional_details:
The law says you have to either divorce by waiting 2 years or 5 years OR you have to choose a reason like "adultery" or "unreasonable behaviour" or "desertion". 
"Why should it be easy? Kids need their parents to stay together" I hear you say...The trouble is, lawyers get round the divorce law very easily, but at great expense to their clients. Letters about petitions back and forth, outrage at the particulars, common sense out the window. ££££ for lawyers. Madness! Sign the petition to help.

attributes.action: that caravans are only allowed on the public highway between 11pm and 6am.
attributes.background: Caravans are the bane of road users throughout the UK. If they can only travel at night then it will keep the country's roads clear during the day.
attributes.additional_details:
All you have to do is find a slow moving line of traffic in the summer and there will be 1 or 2 monster sized caravans being pulled by some woefully under powered car. To add to it, it will be rammed to the roof with holiday kit.
Get this menace out of the way during the day and keep the traffic moving.

attributes.action: Require universities to provide night-time safety to stop sexual harassment
attributes.background: Improve safety around the University at night for women and men when traveling and walking around the site.

attributes.action: Free childcare for parents who want to return to work , child is 4 months +
attributes.background: I think parents who want to return to work and can't afford childcare should have free childcare provided or help with at least 30 hours a week.
attributes.additional_details: Childcare can be expensive and many parents find working a full week only pays childcare fees, this leeds to many parents quitting jobs to try and save some money.

attributes.action: Restore incentives for community owned renewable onshore wind
attributes.background:
A recent report reveals more than two thirds of the public support renewable energy schemes where projects are undertaken at a community level and local people receive financial benefit.
We , the signatories of this petition call upon parliament to revisit support for on shore wind subsidies.
attributes.additional_details:
News story on Community Energy report :
http://www.theecologist.org/News/news_round_up/2988096/massive_support_for_community_renewable_energy.html

attributes.action: All NHS ambulance trusts to use a life saving database which is free to use
attributes.background: The AUXILIUM SYSTEM was invented and funded after two local girls were killed on the way to and from school. The database was developed over several years from discussion with many Doctors Paramedics, Ambulance Hub Personnel etc. The database will be free for the NHS to use now and forever.
attributes.additional_details: If a person wearing an AUXILIUM number is found unconscious the number can be read to an ambulance call centre, then person’s information is relayed to paramedics regarding the patient before the paramedics arrive on the scene. .The AUXILIUM number costs only £1 per year per person, and you can change as many times as you wish .AUXILIUM has offered around 1,000,000 lifesaving numbers to charities and is now able to offer all schools in the UK a free number for all their pupils around 8 million.

attributes.action: Remove the words European Union from British passports.
attributes.background: As the country has voted to leave the European Union, we believe that the words European Union should be removed from British passports. Furthermore, we believe that the original black passports should be reinstated as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Amend Consumer Protection Act 1987 to include advice given by consumer experts
attributes.background: Advice given by travel consumer experts in the media is always minimal. So much information is omitted that if anyone follows the advice they may suffer financial losses. The CPA 1987 should be amended to force these experts to explain what risks are involved in following their suggestions.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g. - Ravi Rajani on ITV's Lorraine (11/8/16) 
He did not warn of the financial risk when booking travel separately. This is irresponsible coming so soon after the collapse of a holiday company with inadequate financial cover. A consumer champion should advise that the protection offered by the Package Travel, Package Holidays and Package Tours Regulations 1992 and Atol is far more important than saving pennies on the booking.

attributes.action: Have a referendum on term time leave from school for families, and not be fined
attributes.background: Many working families either cannot afford school holiday prices or parents cannot get time off work during the school holidays. Families feel that we are being penalised by being threatened with fines or prison and that children are missing out quality family time.
attributes.additional_details: By having this referendum it will give families hope that the government is listening to families and understand there frustrations, school is very important to a child's future but so is the opportunity of spending really quality time with there family once a year for a one week or two week break.

attributes.action: Benefits paid onto a government photo ID which limits what can be purchased.
attributes.background:
Sign this so that tax payers benefits are not spent on holidays, cigarettes, drugs, alcohol or sky TV etc.  
Benefits should not pay for luxuries or for people to go out socialisng and buying items working people consider luxury and difficult to afford.
attributes.additional_details:
People on benefits need support to live but they should not be able to spend this tax payers support on items working class people struggle to afford.  Shops would be limited in the items they can sell and prosecuted if they sell alcohol, cigarettes, lottery tickets, holidays etc. 
Pre-loaded cards should be in  the form of photo ID and a database to have the ability to store the bar codes of items purchased as a way for debt advisors to support budgeting if required.

attributes.action: Increase government funding on organisations aiding terminal illness patients
attributes.background: Hospices and other organisations dedicate de to aiding those suffering from terminal illnesses such as dementia or cancer have been undervalued, either by a lack of pay or by an equal lack of resources, together we can increase welfare funding for such organisations such as these to beneficiaries.
attributes.additional_details: Organisations that enlist the aid of care professionals often being undervalued is often being seen in our headlines, our media is very biased in the covering of care workers and thus fewer people are as inclined to openly support the patients, their familles and carers through more comprehensive grief counselling and resources to truly allow these people a chance to live happily and find contentement despite any terminal illnesses.

attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).

attributes.action: Revise the Honours system.
attributes.background: A cross-party body be set up to radically review the UK Honours system and replace it with one that works according to widely supported criteria and does not reward people for their political allegiances.
attributes.additional_details: Transparent and publicly supported criteria for awarding honours are required which reward people for services to community, the economy, country, mankind and the natural world, but not solely for political allegiance.

attributes.action: Cross party review of Hinkley Point C costs, design risks and EDF's commitment.
attributes.background:
Hinkley Point C go-ahead is imminent.
Review needed of:
- construction costs,
- design risks (design known to be a problem / unproven),
- EDF's commitment to UK project given their own nuclear fleet needs refurbishment,
- agreed strike-price and top up by customers now power prices have fallen
attributes.additional_details:
http://stophinkley.org/StopPress.htm
https://secure.greenpeace.org.uk/page/s/osborne-dont-waste-billions-nuclear?source=em&subsource=20160307egem01&utm_source=gpeace&utm_medium=em&utm_campaign=20160307egem01

attributes.action: Call for the DVLA to standardise gender identification on UK licences
attributes.background: Join us to campaign for gender equality. While licences for men start with their first name, all women have their first name prefixed with a marital status title such as 'Miss' / 'Mrs'. These options are selected at application stage, but whereby men selecting 'Mr' do not have this appear, women do.
attributes.additional_details: As a British National, only two forms of photo ID are recongnised; your passport and driver's licence. You driving licence is designed to be credit card sized, and in robust, thick plastic to be carried on your person at all times (unlike a paper passport). I love our country believe that in 2016 persons should be allowed to have their main, day-to-day ID display a fair indicator of the gender they identify with, rather than singling out women with a relationship status.

attributes.action: Bring back levels for assessment and stop labelling our children as failures.
attributes.background: Children who don't meet the expected standard for their year group are being assessed as emerging and not 'Year _ ready'. Essentially we are telling them they have failed! Children need encouragement not labelling in this way. Levels mean that progress can easily be seen year on year.
attributes.additional_details: A whole generation of our children risk being labelled failures by the system that replaced levels. Previously a child and their parents would easily see progress during a school year by looking at their levels. Currently they are labelled as 'emerging', 'expected' or 'exceeding' and a child who is emerging is then described as not being ready for the next year group that they move in to. If our children are to achieve their true potential, we need to stop labelling them as failures!

attributes.action: Put pressure on Asian governments to stop the inhumane act of shark finning.
attributes.background: Shark numbers are declining due to shark finning - this is when a live shark is taken out of the ocean to have its fin cut off and then thrown back into the water. A shark needs its fin to swim and ultimately to survive. Without it the shark soon dies as it can no longer fend for itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year an estimated 100-200 million sharks are caught for their fins, which often go into the Asian delicacy 'fin soup'. Sharks have been populating our oceans since before the dinosaurs and we can't lose them now. Sharks also play a crucial role in the ecosystem of the ocean by eating sick and dead animals and keeping the seas healthy. By saving sharks we save the oceans and the planet. Shark finning has no place in our modern world and must stop before we lose this ancient species forever.

attributes.action: Ensure there are dedicated disability wards for over 18s in hospitals
attributes.background: Our beautiful disabled daughter/Sister age 26 died of Pneumonia and we think the care of the ward could of been a lot better if there was a dedicated ward with 1 to 1 care and trained disability nurses!

attributes.action: Empty black bins once a week in summer and hot spells.
attributes.background: I, like many others suffer during the summer and sometimes other seasons  with fly and maggots in my black bin, even though I have it cleaned after every empty. I think the government should force councils to empty the black bins once a week during hot spells to reduce this.

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of Economics at GCSE level.
attributes.background: Teaching Politics does not help voters make an informed decision on matters such as the EU Referendum, as it is largely an economical matter. It gives us little insight to the implications of our decisions. Economics gives children factual knowledge to allow them to form decisions on such matters.
attributes.additional_details:
The effect a decision will have on the economy is central to any debate or issue. To make an informed decision, people require knowledge (e.g how free markets work) and the effect their vote will have on the economy. Knowledge of Economics allows students to make educated and substantial choices.

By teaching Economics, this is providing students skills for adult life, a major issue with schools as they fail to teach students skills useful in adult life such as budgeting, taxes and employment.

attributes.action: Honour our Queen by minting coins in real silver
attributes.background: Being a metal detectorist my friends and I find so many beautiful ancient coins that have stood up to being buried for centuries.  The coins we have now would have all rotted away of a similar period, let's honour our Queen by minting a few nice silver coins.
attributes.additional_details: Take a look at the Spinks coin book and you can see many examples of the beautiful coins our Monarchy once had minted in their name. For me to give examples I would need to be able to upload examples of Silver Hammered coins or the Silver Milled ones of more recent times.

attributes.action: Take action to make victims feel more able to report sexual violence.
attributes.background: According to "An overview of Sexual Offending"(Jan 2013) 57% of women who have been raped told someone but not the police, 28% told no one. More must be done to ensure that victims feel able to report incidents and be taken seriously. I suggest closer collaboration with charities such as rape crisis
attributes.additional_details:
See "An Overview of Sexual Offendinf in England and Wales" (Ministry of Justice, Home Office &a Office for National Statistics) for more general statistics. 
I submit this petition in the hope that it will prompt wider debate about the way in which sexual violence is treated within the criminal justice system and how victims are treated.

attributes.action: Save Dunelm House (Durham Uni student union), by giving it Grade II listing.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State has refused an application from Historic England for Grade II listing. The granting of a Certificate of Immunity is now being considered with the intention that the building be demolished. We would like the Secretary to reconsider Grade II listing status.
attributes.additional_details:
It won both a Civic Trust award and the RIBA Bronze Medal 1966. The building has subsequently been praised many times. It needs to be saved as a key piece of architectural herritage. 

Catherine Croft, Director of C20 Society: “We consider Dunelm House to be a remarkably intact survivor of its era...  ...We are extremely disappointed that the Minister has chosen to disregard the view of her heritage advisers (Historic England) and the Society in making this decision.”

attributes.action:
Give Foster Carers employee rights. 
Why do they have to be self employed
attributes.background:
why is it Foster Carers Are forced to be self employed in  a highly regulated profession. Local Authorities and Independent fostering agencies can get away without offering their foster Carers employment rights. 
 Foster Carers can only work for one IFA or LA they are not independent contractors

attributes.action: Ban FRACKING in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Fracking leads to devastating consequences for the environment. 
It contaminates groundwater with the use of toxic chemicals, contaminates the land, can cause earthquakes!
attributes.additional_details: Science!!!

attributes.action: Have a progressive capital gains tax in the U.K for high net worth individuals.
attributes.background: Only wealthy people make large gains on their assets; yet they pay the same as working people earning £11,000 to £43,000 per year; this is obviously unfair and perpetuates inequality. Let's create a fairer society where our taxes don't benefit the wealthy and everyone really pays their fair share.
attributes.additional_details:
The FTSE 100 average yearly gain is 5.4% (Motley Fool UK).  Yet average yearly earning income increases between 2001 and 2016 is just 2.3% (ONS). Clearly a CGT rate of 20% benefits the wealthy.
CGT shouldn't change for companies, only for high net worth individuals. Capital investment is essential to our economy; and individuals won't be put off investing if they have to pay 40% on their profits like everyone else. Changing CGT would improve inequality and provide revenue for the government.

attributes.action: Not new grammar schools, put the funding into high achieving comprehensives.
attributes.background: In September, PM Theresa May announced the government's plans to reintroduce selective state education in the form of grammar schools. Students are selected by 11+ exams, not the age to be determining the schooling for the next 7 years. The government should prioritise existing comprehensives.
attributes.additional_details: The Government want these schools to be allowed to be created once again. This was not what was voted for in the 2015 Conservative manifesto, David Cameron was highly against grammar schools. The money should go to the success that is comprehensive schools. Studies have shown that comprehensive students have fared better at university and they achieve, even with non selection, competitive grades, why should the government try to separate students rather than fund comprehensive schooling more?

attributes.action: Make Bioptic Lenses acceptable for achieving the eyesight standard for driving.
attributes.background: Bioptic Lenses are small optical scopes, that are mounted onto the spectacle frame, to help people with sight loss see extra detail in distant objects or texts. Often used to assist visually impaired individuals that still have a functional level of vision to complete everyday tasks such as driving.
attributes.additional_details: Bioptic driving began over 30 years ago in the US and is currently accepted in over 37 states as well as several European Countries, for both car and motorcycle licenses.  Current UK standards for driving have taken away the freedom and independence of thousands of individuals that would otherwise pose no additional risk to road users.  Consideration, in particular, should be given to those with stable non-progressive visual disorders, where Bioptics would allow them to meet the vision standard.

attributes.action: Preserve current opt-outs should the UK decide to rejoin the EU in the future.
attributes.background: The UK's recent vote to leave the EU saw young people vote overwhelmingly to remain, making it possible that future public opinion will favour rejoining. To make this process smoother we hereby call upon the government to preserve the UK's current opt-outs for potential future membership.
attributes.additional_details: Opt-outs are when EU Member States decide not to participate in European legislation or treaties. As a member since 1973, the UK opted out of both the Euro and the Schengen Agreement on passport-free movement of people. However, countries wishing to join in future may not opt out of such agreements permanently. Therefore, preserving current opt-outs for a future British application to rejoin the EU would make the terms of future membership more favourable.

attributes.action: Allow all children of all ages to receive the meningitis B vaccine on the NHS
attributes.background: Meningitis B is rhe most common cause of bacterial Meningitis by which children's lives are taken. As vaccines are the only way to prevent meningitis this vaccine should be offered to all children, not just those born after June 2015. It can be paid for privately which many people cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.meningitis.org/menb-vaccine

attributes.action: Make learning a foreign language compulsory from the 1st year of primary school
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest levels of multi-linguistic speakers. By keeping up with our European neighbours we will open up travel for the individual and business for the nation. The best way to learn a foreign language is to learn continuously from a young age, when the brain is most capable.
attributes.additional_details: Communication is key in international business and the UK government wishes to see more students taking up a foreign language at university. To facilitate a future nation of polyglots we need to prioritise foreign language as a core subject for children. Starting from the age of 5, or younger, when it's easiest to learn, and to be taught continuously through to adolescence so that every future adult has at least basic secondary language skills.

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Invoke NATO Article 4 consultation on establishing a "No-Fly" zone over Syria.
attributes.background: Syrian and Russian airstrikes target civilian population centres, schools and medical centres, weaponising refugees and making living in non government areas untenable. This not only constitutes a warcrime but effectively endangers NATO and EU cohesion, as a planned and desired secondary objective.
attributes.additional_details:
A "No-Fly" zone would force the Syrian and Russian regime to take the peace talks seriously, stop the scheduled and intentional murder of innocent civilians and allow for the implementation of much needed humanitarian aid. It would also be an effective first step in allowing Syrian refugees to return home.

Secondly we respectfully request that her Majesty's government petition the International Tribunal in the Hague to prosecute those who planned, ordered and willingly executed said warcrimes.

attributes.action: Help more young people and Adults with Autism into Employment.
attributes.background: I have a autistic spectrum condition and I have managed with support into gradual full time employment. Just because we have Autism doesn't make us incapable or means we can't work like any other person.

attributes.action: Make the Punishment fit the Crime
attributes.background: Today the Victim does Not get Justice in Many cases, Causing Death by say Dangerous Driving when they get their sentence Cut in Half and winds up around Two years per Life makes life Cheap, they should be Banned for say Ten years and Ten years per life taken, they will not learn by a slap on hand.
attributes.additional_details:
More sentences are stupid when handed out, Victims Must see Justice done for their Loss, many Stupid Boy Racers who should never be on the road for others Safety.

They also Must pass their Test again.

Also this Applies to All other Deaths by whatever means.

Let's Stop Silly Sentences being handed out from the Courts, bet they would not like it for one of their family Members.

attributes.action: Amend the Equality Act (2010) to include all gender identities and expressions
attributes.background: The Equality Act (2010) made important strides when it included making it unlawful to discriminate against transsexuals. However this excludes all other gender identities that fall under the Transgender umbrella, therefore taking away their freedom to be themselves for fear of persecution.

attributes.action: Article 50 Lisbon treaty can only be invoked by 2/3 's majority of MP's
attributes.background:
The recent referendum showed different needs across the UK. 
As a parliamentary democracy we trust in elected MP's to make decisions on our behalf. 
Only a plan that a significant majority of MP's can support will re-unite the UK
attributes.additional_details:
There is currently no plan. It is the job of parliament  to ensure 
that before article 50 is invoked there is robust, coherent and competent plan in place that is in the interests of the UK as a whole and will deliver clear advantages and benefits to the UK over the current status quo as a member of the European Union.

attributes.action: Teach children in schools about voting and parliament - primary school onwards.
attributes.background: After the recent referendum and outcomes of general elections I feel there's a clear need for people to be taught about the process, as well as learning to cross reference and rattify information to ensure they're making a truly informed decision.

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: Make MP's send yearly report to their constituents.
attributes.background: In a time of information and misinformation I propose that MP's send a report to each of their constituents outlying which bills they have voted for, against or abstained. Their attendance in office and parliament and their expenses.
attributes.additional_details: As public servants and representatives of the people, MP's should send information of what they have voted for (on our behalf), so we can decide if we choose to keep them in office. I am aware that this information is in the public domain, but is not readily available to us all. In a society where we celebrate  democracy, the MP's should be happy for us to see what they are doing and allow us to celebrate their achievements by voting them in next time.

attributes.action: Preserve the UK bat population by banning wind farms
attributes.background: All species of UK bats are protected by the law. Wind farms are killing thousands of them each year.Bats have been around for 30 million years able to fly without the risk of colliding with spinning objects. They deactivate their sonar when near turbines and are attracted to the bugs drawn to them.
attributes.additional_details:
At 29 of the 46 UK wind farms examined 194 were killed monthly- a likely gross underestimate. Carried over to the 6,954 onshore turbines the carnage is tens of thousands.
Dr Lintott suggests turning off turbines during high risk periods. 
On October 2016 227 megawatts (just 0.6% of the 36,759 mW being used) was from turbines, 70%from coal; 21% nuclear; 8% from abroad.
We need forms of reliable renewable energy to deliver electricity at competitive prices that do not devastate the bat population.

attributes.action: Tax all products containing palm oil
attributes.background: The production of palm oil is a dangerous and environmentaly disastrous procedure. It produces vast quantities of CO2 as well as damaging local ecosystems and the worldwide environment. Place a tax on all products in the UK to reduce its sales.

attributes.action: Allow rape victims to receive forensic examination and results before reporting
attributes.background: Potential rape victims often can't find out whether they have ingested a date rape drug unless they take legal action and report the crime. This involves undergoing a 3 hour forensic examination, making a video statement, and the arrest of the accused. They may also be forced to appear in court.
attributes.additional_details: Date rape drugs leave the system within 72 hours of being ingested, and forensic examinations should be made within this time frame too, so that the victim can eat, drink and shower normally. The decision to report is heavy, and should be given time. When forced to make a decision so quickly, victims are often pressured into reporting their crimes when it isn't in their interest to do so. Victims should have the right to receive the forensic examination and its results before reporting.

attributes.action: Allow freedom of movement to continue within the tech sector
attributes.background: The UK has a skills shortage when it comes to tech, and in order for us to remain the digital capital of Europe. We must allow talent to come easily into the UK. A complicated visa process will mean that talent goes elsewhere and we suffer as a result of it.

attributes.action: Enforce harsher penalties for those who breach airports during protests
attributes.background: Recently, many "protesters" from environmental groups have been breaching airports and standing on runways. This is highly illegal, but they always leave with very small fines at worst.

attributes.action: Investigate the UK's role in launching airstrikes during the Syrian ceasefire
attributes.background: US Secretary of State John Kerry referred to the recent truce in Syria as the "last chance" for peace (1). Despite this, the UK "unintentionally" killed 62 Syrian soldiers in an airstrike during the ceasefire (2). We the undersigned demand to know how the UK put global stability at risk in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
The United Kingdom elected to become directly involved in the devastating Syrian conflict when our parliament voted in 2015 to join a coalition of nations performing airstrikes in the region(3).
Now we have broken a truce that our allies helped to establish.

(1) - http://news.sky.com/story/syria-ceasefire-begins-amid-concerns-from-rebel-groups-10575628
(2) - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-37409236
(3) - https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2015/december/mps-debate-motion-on-isil-in-syria/

attributes.action: Vote on whether the Houses of Parliament should be refurbished or rebuilt.
attributes.background: In a time of mass austerity, £4b to refurbish The Houses of Parliament over 6 years NOT including fees for renting elsewhere. £7.1b over 32 years if they stay inside. We the people believe that the palace should be kept for historical value and a new building be built for a fraction of the price.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence is there. This needs to be done and the savings go back into the publics purse, helping stop austerity on the sick and disabled. Fund more homeless shelters, stock the food banks!!! Act NOW not tomorrow!

http://www.express.co.uk/news/uk/708740/houses-of-parliament-restoration-48bn-to-do-list-westminster

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-refurbishment-7bn-westminster-revamp-faces-three-year-delay-a6872141.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37303682

attributes.action: Provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift everywhere
attributes.background: Argyll and Bute are cutting green bin waste collections by a third in Kintyre without providing a safe, secure or easily accesible alternative which has lead to feelings of insecurity, people buying bins out of their own pocket when they already pay council tax.
attributes.additional_details: Aim of this petiiton is to provide legislation to maintain the same level of weekly waste uplift in each area (I.e if an area was originally green bin only at 140l weekly and then becomes 2/3 weekly still at 140l the council must provide other recycling bins that add up to the same total of 140l a week) So a 2 weekly collection would be 2 bins at 140l (one recycling, one not) 3 weekly would be 3 140l or 1 140l and 1 280l.

attributes.action: We want to make a change to the government cuts towards disabled people.
attributes.background: NCS Wave 9 Black Country A Team Jackman are campaigning to help change the attitude of the government and where they place their money. They have cut back too much on the funding for the disabled and we want to make a change, this petition will help us make that difference that could change lives.
attributes.additional_details: We are working with our Patener charity Let Us Play, an organisation that works with disabled and vulnerable children from the ages 5-19. They do amazing work to help the children have a fun filled life. However they struggle to get the essentials that they need due to the government cuts towards disabled people for example, there used to be 27 rest bite beds in Wolverhampton alone and over the past few years it has reduced to 3. How unfair is that?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to fly the Union Flag on all public buildings.
attributes.background: The UK appears to have a most disgraceful fear of displaying our national flag on public buildings, on the grounds of either some misplaced sense of danger under health & safety legislation or for fear of offending some minority group.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is one of the only countries in the world where the flying of the national flag is actively discouraged by local councils and governmental bodies. This is a national & international disgrace.

The UK has decided that it no longer wishes to be politically associated with our European neighbours, rather to display our independence. Yet we are actively discouraged from showing our national flag as a symbol of that very independence.
